channel.title: 2 on Qian Yang
channel.description: Recent content in 2 on Qian Yang

item.title: Secure users oriented downlink MISO NOMA
Secure short-packet communications for mission-critical IoT applications
item.description: A secure IoT communication system in which an access point transmits confidential short-packet information to a trusted actuator in the presence of eavesdropping. The average secrecy throughput obtained by the simulation versus blocklength and the transmitted bit number per block under the case with a single-antenna AP, where the star markers denote the optimal blocklength and the corresponding approximated secrecy throughput.

item.title: Delivery-secrecy tradeoff for cache-enabled stochastic networks: Content placement optimization
item.description: An illustration for the optimal cache placement strategy under different file secrecy levels, where the shadowed parts stand for the optimal placement probability.

item.title: Wireless powered asynchronous backscatter networks with sporadic short packets: Performance analysis and optimization
item.description: Stochastic B-WPC ad hoc network consisting of multiple RFID reader-tag pairs.

item.title: NOMA in downlink SDMA with limited feedback: Performance analysis and optimization
item.description: The considered downlink cellular network with a multi-antenna BS and multiple single-antenna users. The NOMA technology is exploited to simultaneously serve multiple users under each spatial beam of SDMA.

item.title: Joint source-relay secure precoding for MIMO relay networks with direct links
Energy-efficient transmission design in non-orthogonal multiple access
Safeguarding decentralized wireless networks using full-duplex jamming receivers
Physical layer security in MIMO backscatter wireless systems
item.description: The MIMO backscatter system, consisting of a RFID reader, a RFID tag, and a passive eavesdropper.

item.title: Secrecy sum rate maximization in non-orthogonal multiple access
